channel.title: Tim Videos Planet - Developers news - Tag: JEKYLL
channel.description: News from our best developers, all news aggregated by planet.

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/money
pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/pinoss.github.io
pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/getting-started
[GSoC Snippet] 19/06/2014
item.description:
[design] small modification, move includes into folder, add edit button and connect it with GitHub Api Interface
[talk] a lot of talk with Tim about my project, about main goals, ideas, etc. :+1:
[code] created edit link liquid tag to easly adding edit tag, you only need to specify path for editing tool and all links will be generated automatically
[code] created People page that fetches data from GitHub on client side (needs to be ported to fetch data on server side)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: [GSoC] What hapenned during this week (week 4)
item.description:
During 4th week I was working on setting our websites to be monitored.

I've done some research, read a lot of articles about monitoring tools and I was so confused about all monitoring tools so I've chosen first from my list; and the choice was great. Monitis.com is very simple monitoring tool that has basic and advanced features, but suits our need in 100%, I've set monitoring for basic HTTP transaction (Monitis checks every one minute from 5-6 destinations if site is alive and if response has text to verify if page exists on requested address), full page load (to monitor time of website loading) and list of transactions (where Monitis plays previously recorded script).

I've added also many small and medium size features to planet.timvideos.us, like:
- social buttons on every post (for Twitter, Facebook and Google+), I am thinking about adding Pocket or other to save post to read it later;
- added excerpt for each post, it's fully configurable in _config.yml, so you can select how many words you want to display in excerpt;
- added Emoji support in post, so you can use Emoji's in your posts, like :1: :smile: :cinema:
- added small tooltip with information about time of reading selected post before you start reading,
- added generate tag, category pages, opml and rss feeds filtered by tags and categories, you can reach them with new RESTfull like routes: ie. planet.timvideo.us/categories/gsoc-2014/tags/news or planet.timvideos.us/tags/github or planet.timvideos.us/categories/gsoc-2014-hdmi2usb (if you want to download RSS or OPML just click on icons that are on the left of category/tag name in top right part of panel;
- fixed bug with wrongly attached layout for some posts,
- small css fixes;
- started working on People part of code.timvideos.us and pulling data from GitHub API

Next week I will work on code.timvideos.us and adding new features for that website and make it awesome!
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/jekyll-plugins
[GSoC Snippet] 12/06/2014
item.description:
[admin] installed Ruby 1.9.3 on my development machine
[code] fixed emoji on Ruby 1.9.3
[research] done some research about Travis CI, unfortunately we can use that app only with getting started page to autobuild and push changes to gh-pages (Travis CI runs workers only if there was a git push or git pull request, running ie. every 10 minuts its not possible). I will try to add capybara tests to each project to make sure that after every build page works properly. I hope that is possible.
[code] Added generation of rss by all categories and tags, tomorrow I will add new routes to each element.
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 11/06/2014
item.description:
[code] Added social buttons for each post (twitter, facebook, google+) to add ability for visitors to share news on their walls (I can add button for pocket, pinterest if someone would like to have that buttons :))
[code] Added 'read it in X minutes' tooltip above button 'Read more'
[code] Added post excerpt with configurable word amount to display on main page
[code] I've noticed a bug on website generated by server: If you click on post and you want to display it it will show without sidebar (on my local machine everythings working properly). I can't find any causes of that problem, I am trying to find reasons of that behavior, there are 2 possible problems:
- order of generation plugins is not deterministic if all plugins have same priority, maybe on servers there is another priority that causes problems, I am trying to give plugins correct order, but since all works correctly on my machine I have to experiment on server. Second possible reason is Ruby version, I haven't installed Ruby 1.9.3 on my machine but I need to do that to make sure that everything work correctly.
[code] Added Emoji support, but it has some incompatibility with Ruby 1.9.3 and causes problems with generation, so I reverted my changes. I need to update Ruby on servers or rewrite plugin to use 1.9.3.

Plans for tomorrow/next days:
[code] add feeds per all categories and tags (rss xml and opml)
[code] add import tag information from RSS feed
[code] add inform on irc if new page has been generated
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer
